name: Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana
info: It has the objectives of adding diversity to the incomes of rural poor families and cater to the career aspirations of rural youth.
eligibility: DDU-GKY is uniquely focused on rural youth between the ages of 15 and 35 years from poor families.

name: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana
info: The risk coverage under the scheme isRs.2 lakh for accidental death and full disability and Rs. 1 lakh for partial disability.
eligibility: The Scheme is available to people in the age group 18 to 70 years with a bank account.

name: National Literacy Mission Programme
info: National Literacy Mission (NLM) was set up by the government of India on 5th May 1988 with an aim to eradicate illiteracy in the country
eligibility: The target group of NLM is people between the age of 15 and 35

name: Pradhan Mantri Matritva Vandana Yojana
info: Pradhan Mantri Matritva Vandana Yojana is a maternity benefit program run by the government of India.
eligibility: Lactating mothers and pregnant women in case of the birth of the first child in the family are eligible for the scheme.

name: Mahila Shakti Kendra
info: The scheme aims to empower rural women through community participation and to create an environment in which they realize their full potential.
eligibility: Activities of community engagement will be carried out by student volunteers in 115 backward districts.

name: Janani Suraksha Yojana
info: Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY) is a safe motherhood intervention under the National Rural Health Mission (NRHM) being implemented with the objective of reducing maternal and neo-natal mortality
eligibility: The scheme focuses on the poor pregnant woman with special dispensation for states having low institutional delivery rates

name: Midday Meal Scheme
info: The Midday Meal Scheme is a school meal programme in India designed to better the nutritional standing of school-age children nationwide. The programme supplies free lunches on working days for children in primary and upper primary classes in government schools
eligibility: It is eligiblet o all school going children in primary classes

name: Atal Pension Yojana
info: Atal Pension Yojana is a Social Security Scheme introduced by Govt. of India, aimed at providing a steady stream of income to the elderly
eligibility: It is eligible to all citizens of India after the age of 60.

name: CBSE Udaan Scheme
info: The main objective of this program is to increase the enrolment rate of girls in the engineering colleges of the country.
eligibility: It is eligible to higher secondary school girls.

name: Mahila-E-Haat
info: Mahila E- Haat an unique direct on line marketing platform to support women entrepreneurs/ SHGs/ NGOs
eligibility: It is applicable to all women citizens of India over the age of 18.

name: Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya
info: The Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya or KGBV is a residential girls’ secondary school run by the Government of India for the weaker sections in India.
eligibility: It is eligible for places with concentration of SC, OBC and minority populations, with low female literacy and/or many girls out of school.

name: Balika Samriddhi Yojana
info: To change negative family and community attitudes towards the girl child at birth and towards her mother.
eligibility: The Balika Samriddhi Yojana will cover girl children in families below the poverty line (BPL) as defined by the Government of India, in rural and urban areas, who are born on or after 15 August, 1997.

name: Inspire Programme
info: INSPIRE is an innovative programme developed by the the Department of Science & Technology to attract talent to the excitement and study of science at an early age
eligibility: Candidates who have qualified 10+2 and are pursuing courses in natural science are eligible for the scholarship.

name: Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana
info: Risk coverage under this scheme is for Rs. 2 Lakh in case of death of the insured, due to any reason.
eligibility: The PMJJBY is available to people in the age group of 18 to 50 years having a bank account

name: Integrated Child Development Services
info: It is the foremost symbol of country’s commitment to its children and nursing mothers, as a response to the challenge of providing pre-school non-formal education
eligibility: Children in the age group 0-6 years are eligible for this
